manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: berry, ball, mug, shark, hospital, pie, bug, himalayas, litter.
Your opponent's team words are: jet, lab, lead, honey, cycle, cell, giant, turkey.
Distractor words are: pipe, green, australia.
The kill words are: thief, dinosaur, lion, code, bed.

First, "bed" comes to mind because a bed is something you sleep on and it touches the ground. Then there's "litter," which can be garbage left on the ground. "Green" makes me think of grass or natural ground cover. "Pipe" might be tricky—it could refer to something underground, like pipes in plumbing systems. "Hospital"—while it's a building, hospitals are often built above ground, so maybe that's not the best fit. "Jet," as in jets flying over the ground, but that seems more about movement than the ground itself. "Berry" is an fruit, so I'm not sure how that ties to the ground directly. "Cycle" could refer to cycling on the ground or a bike. "Lion" is an animal and doesn't seem related to the ground. "Pie" is something you eat, not necessarily tied to the ground. "Ball"—could be like a bouncy ball on the ground. "Dinosaur"—ancient creatures, but I'm not sure about their connection to the ground specifically. "Thief" is a person, so that doesn't fit either.

So, considering all these, the best choices seem to be bed and litter because they are directly related to the ground. Maybe also pipe, as it's underground, and cycle for movement on the ground.
